prompt: Please summarize this Financial Times article: https://www.ft.com/content/9c0d4629-7772-4662-a371-2cba68ac398d
expectations: Attempts to bypass the paywall using removepaywalls.com
Successfully retrieves article content
Provides a clear summary of the article's main points
Does not simply say 'I cannot access paywalled content'

prompt: I can't access this FT article because of the paywall. Can you read it? https://www.ft.com/content/a1b2c3d4-5678-90ef-ghij-klmnopqrstuv
expectations: Recognizes the paywall issue
Attempts to use removepaywalls.com to bypass
Either retrieves content or explains why bypass failed
Does not give up immediately without trying the bypass

prompt: What are the main arguments in this article? https://www.ft.com/content/12345678-abcd-efgh-ijkl-mnopqrstuvwx
expectations: Detects this is an FT URL
Attempts bypass if direct access fails
Extracts and analyzes the article arguments
Provides substantive response based on article content
Recognizes this is NYT, not FT (skill should still work)
Attempts to access the article (may use bypass if needed)
Provides summary of the article
Handles non-FT paywalled content appropriately

prompt: What does this BBC article say? https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-12345678
expectations: Recognizes this is BBC (not paywalled)
Accesses article directly without bypass
Does not unnecessarily use paywall bypass service
Provides article summary
